The big challenge has really been BIG W because most of those opportunities are in the major property holders like Westfields et cetera and they clearly slowed down during that time. So we've been out looking for standalone marketplace developments, so there's a bit of a lead time on that but that's why we're comfortable in saying we're going to be able to ramp up the BIG W numbers pretty strong over the next couple of years because we've actually bought bigger blocks of land to put a supermarket, a Dan Murphy, a BIG W and Dick Smith and specialties et cetera, so sub-regional centers.
Yeah, so more BIG Ws outside .

And I must say, the most sought after asset that we've seen so far in our property sale have in fact been these sub-regionals where we've actually put a kit together and they can see the quality of the build and the quality of the offering and the car parking chips that we put a lot of thought into. So they're very much sought after assets.
So, just getting back to that $2.5 billion on the balance sheet, how much again would a timeframe, but how much of that would we eventually expect to come back?

Oh look that's a difficult question to answer, but some assets we are going to hold because they're of strategic importance to us and there's no way we'd let the site go for a particular reason. But in the main, we're not a holder of property assets so we will cycle through them when the market conditions are right.
That's probably you know given that our growth and our float's somewhere between $1 billion and $2 billion would probably be a good guess on where we might go depending on how sales go.
Yep, understand. I'm just thinking also but traditionally there has been a little bit of a seasonal weakness in the second half EBIT margin and do you think we'll see the same again next year?

That's mainly because of Christmas and it always – I mean the first and second halves in terms of sales profile and profit profile are always different because of the mix of products that you sell, so I don't see that changing this year. What will change of course is Easter's moved into the fourth quarter so unfortunately when we release the next sales numbers they're going to be raw and Easter adjusted again. We need to get Easter moved to, I don't know, permanently in February or something like that and make life a lot easier.

No I'm just thinking – looking at the EBIT margins across the tail, I mean the last year you actually posted higher EBIT margin in the second half than the first half, but given the preceding year, the first half is always stronger so that's .
We'll let you know as soon as we finish the year.
Oh okay and the other one's on Home Improvement. Home Improvement and the other small acquisitions et cetera-

Sorry, you just have to slow down and maybe just – we're only catching – it's getting a bit garbled so I apologize it's not your fault it's the line, but if you could just – we'll give a good answer if we hear the question.
No, I guess have to speak a bit more slowly. Home Improvement as a collective didn't make a positive EBIT contribution for the first half?
Yeah, Tom, confirmed that. Yes.
Okay. And it is a minor point but Gage Roads booked loss, I know it's only small so who would have thought it would have been moving in the right direction, can you give a little bit of color there?
We're very lucky to have a board member of Gage Road in our midst, Steven Greentree.
I'm allowed to comment in a Woolworths meeting. We posted a small loss but the second quarter was in profit so we've hoping that we'll be able to maintain that from now on.
Yeah.
That business, Steve, really is in ramp up phase, do you guys -

We've got it now from when we first took a stake in Gage Road it produced about 50,000 cases. At the moment we're on track to do annualized about 1.2 million and we think we can probably do significantly more than that, so we've now got another capacity problem we need to try and solve with Gage. So Gage has been wonderful for our private label business.
Presumably you can marry Cellarmasters capabilities with Gage Road?
They're a bit far apart I think but most of the Cellarmasters establishments are in the but there's probably not a lot of synergy there to be truthful.
Okay .
That's not to say that there's an opportunity for beer being bottled there. You know it just may not be good sourced from Gage Road.
All right, terrific thanks guys.
There are no further questions.
Okay. Was there anybody that had a burning question or you're all looking forward to our wonderful sandwiches? Okay thanks guys for a really interesting set of questions, appreciate it.
